cont.entity_b: Easy to understand and use. Easy to use for brake lines.

cont.entity_a: Effective for cutting and bending rebar.
High cost but cuts and bends rebar that a 12in demo-saw cannot.
No fear of sparks starting a fire.

Capable of cutting and bending 256 48”x12” #4 dowels in 2 hours. Functions perfectly and is durable for rebar bending and cutting. Cuts quickly and does precise preset or custom bends. Handles #5 rebar with ease. Bending is excellent, but cutting is not very good. Works well for #3 and #4 rebar. Cuts 5/8 rebar with no problem. Bends 5/8" rebar effortlessly. No significant issues after extensive use on #4 rebar.
cont.entity_b: Makes precise bends. Works well for 3/8 and 5/16 steel fuel lines. Made precise bends in 5/16 solid aluminum rod. Requires muscle for thicker tubing. Good for bending brake and fuel lines.

cont.entity_a: Bulky at first, but weight is manageable after use. Well-engineered and portable. Light enough to be portable, around 45 lb. Remarkably portable and durable.

Quickly pays for itself in labor savings. Increases efficiency and productivity in construction. Makes the job faster and easier on the body. Saves time and effort compared to manual tools. Transformed efficiency and productivity of company.
Continues to function well after heavy use.
Portable and versatile, cuts up to #5 rebar. Performs as advertised, making job easier and saving time.
cont.entity_b: Sturdy build. Painted bending surfaces leave smudges. Heavy duty and well-crafted. Good fit in slot prevents slipping. Sturdy build, good for harder tubes. Handles are a little short. Not heavy duty but good for light duty.

cont.entity_a: Great for forming variable configured pieces on site.

cont.entity_b: Same radius as other benders. Doesn't kink large tubing.
Requires practice to avoid kinking. Requires careful handling to prevent kinking.
Not suitable for 3/16th brake line. Not suitable for hollow steel tubes.
